Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2009 07:02AM auorarz wrote:  I have tried the " natural hair" eyebrows but it was this summer and when I got hot and a little oily the glue didn't hold and they looked like curled caterpillars on top of my eyes! I was probably the most frustrated with the eyebrows, tried powders and pencils ended up with a combo of both. Within 8wks post Taxol eyebrows were back and stubby eyelashes. I use a product called rapidlash (I have no connection to the product at all) 49.00 compared to 120.00 for Latisse and I think it works , those puppies went from stubby to long in about 4 wks. My PS who told me to try Latisse ( her office sells it) said these products have to be used when lashes are in growth cycle and the chemical within the product sends some signal to the follicles to keep them within that growing cycle ( or something like that!)    I have also tried emu oil on scalp to grow hair and rogaine,3 months post Taxol I have 3/4inch, I d43don't know if that's good or bad...light downy hair came  before Taxol was done.
Posts.Title: Anyone tried false eyebrows? PJB auorarz

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2009 12:27PM auorarz wrote:  Hi Ladies,  I would love to join your group, I had my plan done last week and I go tommorrow for the "dry run" no rads but x-rays to ensure correct area. I am also triple neg, post bilat mx ( had initial rt lumpectomy but BRCA1 )  and I have bilat expanders about 930cc with alloderm.I am to have 22 treatments to axilla , 6 to chest wall. I had quite a few pos nodes. Crossing my fingers the rad expander side holds up.  My rad onc said I can take supplements but none with extra antioxidents  is anyone else taking supplements? I would love to do the one glass of wine a day as the that study suggested but I am conflicted as I thought we were supposed to stay away from alcohol, I'll check with my doc.   Good Luck to us all for smooth sailing treatments
